name: St. Jacques Marquette

locations.description: Jesuit missionary and explorer in New France (Canada and USA)

summary: Jacques Marquette was a French Jesuit priest, missionary, and explorer who worked in New France. He is best known for exploring the Mississippi River with Louis Jolliet in 1673. He established missions among Native American tribes and was known for his linguistic abilities, learning several native languages. He died of dysentery while returning to a mission. He is remembered for his exploration, missionary work, and his respectful approach to Native American cultures.
